author: _shemnon
content: If they are not in the blockchain tests how would we test for clients not enforcing field ranges when the data structure supports out of range values?  Blockchain tests feel the most logical because there is a facility to detect the rejection of a block as out-of-spec.  State-tests?  Not as good a facility. The trick is to ensure that the code section doing the rejection is the runtime code.  That's why engine tests are also a good place for it, no one is emulating engine parsing in their harneses.
